job description:
ROLE SUMMARY

The Biological Quality – Data Analyst will be responsible for compiling, reviewing, analyzing and providing final batch record approval for environmental data including environmental monitoring, utilities (compressed air/gas and water) and critical site sampling. This position will compile, extrapolate, analyze and communicate data patterns within LIMS data and provide Business Unit leadership data for trend reports, weekly excursion reports, audit requests and investigations. In addition, the individual will be responsible for assisting supervision with training, scheduling, releasing and projects as needed and present data regarding BQ systems in regulatory and Third Party audits.

The individual will be expected to have knowledge of LIMS and Trackwise (or equivalent systems).

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES

Strategically assesses statistical and report information from the LIMS database to determine if actions are necessary. Initiate exception reports/investigations. Evaluate potential product impact to both the facility and customer and complete the impact assessment. Provide on demand environmental and utility LIMS data reports to support the various Business Units. Present/participate in site wide data review meetings – MRB, ARB and ERB. Works with members of the board to troubleshoot and resolve issues.

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Bachelor’s degree in a science discipline required.
  • Minimum of 6 years (7 preferred) of experience in a Biology lab and experience with a wide variety of biological techniques (e.g., BET, environmental monitoring, sterility, etc.).
  • Knowledge of cGMPs and regulations inside and outside of the US.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with employees at all levels.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in computer systems.
  • Biological testing experience in drug product pharmaceutical manufacturing preferred.
  • Knowledge of LIMS and Microsoft Office programs is desired.
PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS

Use computer terminal.

NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS

Overtime and weekend work is required as needed. Occasional travel may be required.
